title: As a BOC Admin, I want a new hard error to appear for Clubs trying to submit Add Cs
custom_steps:
AC:

* When a Club has attached the relevant file to the Addendum C, and tries to â€œSubmit,â€� they should we receive a hard error if the following fields have not been filled in:
** State Signed
** City Signed
* The error should read:
** â€œYou must enter the city and state that the Addendum C was signed.â€�

title: As an MNC Admin, I want to update the Assignment Clause on MNCs
custom_steps:
AC:

* On the Assignment Clause of MNCs:
** Update Assignor Roster Type values to:
*** Active Major League Roster
*** 40-Man
** Remove 26-Man and 28-Man
** Update Assignee Roster Type values to:
*** Active Major League Roster
*** 40-Man
** Remove 26-Man and 28-Man
* Existing contracts will not be updated as a result of this change

title: As a BOC user I want any manual changes made to a player's contract year to be final and not reverted by the nightly batch
custom_steps:
Currently manually updating a playerâ€™s contract year is reverted when the nightly contract year batch runs.  Instead, if a user updates the value on the profile it should be considered the final update for that year and the contract year batch should ignore it.

Scenarios that would update:
Player is on inactive list for 14 days and has contract year invalidated (voided) by batch.  User changes value back to earned.  Batch should NOT change value back to invalidated

Player earns contract year via batch.  User changes value to not earned.  Batch should NOT change the value back to earned.

Player has not earned contract year and user changes value to earned.  Batch should NOT change the value back to earned.

if the user has NOT made a change all of these scenarios should continue to work

title: As an EBIS User, I want to see an Information (i) next to the Rookie of the Year Eligibility Widget header
custom_steps:
AC:

* Next to the â€œRookie of the Year Eligibilityâ€� widget header text, there should be an information ( (i) )icon
* Hovering over that icon, should bring up a textbox that reads:
** â€œ_A player shall be considered a rookie unless he has exceeded any of the following thresholds in a previous season (or seasons): 130 at-bats or 50 innings pitched in the Major Leagues. 45 total days on an active Major League roster during the Championship Season (excluding time on the Injured List)._â€�

title: As a Intl Reg Admin, I want to merge a Verfied Profile with Multiple Unverified Profiles
custom_steps:
Related to: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1739|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1739|smart-link] 

AC:

* Users will be able to select one Verified profile to merge with multiple unverified profile
* When the matching modal appears, all the verified profiles information will be selected as the master info by default
** Users will not be able to change this
* When the user proceeds past the matching modal, all expected system updates will occur

title: As a BOC Admin, I want EBIS to remove a contract year if a player has been restricted for 14 or more days in a season
custom_steps:
Related to: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/EBISARC-6489|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/EBISARC-6489|smart-link] 
https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-2050
AC:

* If player is Restricted for 14 days in a season, the player will lose the contract year

title: Convert the Major Contract Award Bonus Packages widget to react
Convert Player Tracking tab to React
custom_steps: Player Tracking page needs to be updated to React, all features should work the same on ebisui and ebisapp.

title: Create a framework for displaying and running screenshot versions of reports from the reporting tab
custom_steps:
The reporting widget will be able to display and run reports built using screenshots (instead of business objects).

Report definition will be configured using a SQL file (similar to batches).

Prompts will be displayed using an ebis modal and this should be part of the report configuration.  There should be two ways of setting up the prompts - a custom modal accessed by a â€˜nameâ€™ or a generic modal using a child table to configure the prompts.

title: SPIKE: Consider using BAM logos in EBIS
custom_steps: EBIS has its own set of logos which are not from BAM. Other EP/BEST systems use BAM logos. Should we do the same to be consistent? Need to look at possible impacts to reports.

title: SPIKE: Websocket/XHR connections during Draft
custom_steps:
During the Draft, we were seeing about 2-3 users per day at some point start hitting the eventbus xhr endpoints, indicating that their websocket connection failed and they are now using the XHR fallback.

2 potential actions to take here: 1. better understand why/when websocket connections fail and the retry mechanism, 2. make xhr flow more resilient and fix 404 / constant reconnect issue.

title: Prevent BData from receiving picks on API during Prod mocks
custom_steps:
There are times when we want to run a mock draft in Production after the BData team has turned their listener on, so we donâ€™t want them to see picks on the API, but we/BOC do want to see the picks.  BDataâ€™s user account is in the â€œUnassignedâ€� org but this org still sees all Production picks on the API, whether in mock mode or not.  We need to decide how we want to address this.

We will add a new RULE4-MOCK-API-VIEWER permission which will be checked for all picks going out when a mock is running.  Permission will not be a part of any role and will need to be manually added to anyone who needs it (and will not be granted to anyone to start)
